page.title: 17A Visit To Durham Cathedral.
page.content: In April a mini-bus took us to Durham Cathedral for an interesting visit. What was particularly good was the Craftsmen for Christ Exhibition in the Norman undercroft.I looked at sone models.One was a stonemason with a hammer.Stonemasons would have sculptured the stone into beautiful shapes.Other models were of monks and I think one could have been of St. Bede who was writing,St.Cuthbert who was holding a cross to his heart,and St.Aidan who was praying. Climbing the cathedral tower I had the following thoughts"325 steps to climb,Icould not go on.We came to half way,not far to go now.Ah,we are at the top,looking down,down.Being up here is a tremendous feeling.The stone worn away by tramping feet". We visited the tombs of S.Cuthbert and St.Bede in the cathedral.
